abstract: The move came shortly after the government said the British economy grew more rapidly in the third quarter than many economists had expected.
snippet: The move came shortly after the government said the British economy grew more rapidly in the third quarter than many economists had expected.
lead_paragraph: Britain’s deficit-cutting plans got an important vote of confidence on Tuesday, as Standard & Poor’s said it raised its outlook for the country’s debt and affirmed its triple-A credit rating.

headline.main: Rating Agency Raises Outlook for Britain After Cuts
headline.print_headline: S.&P. Raises Outlook for Britain’s Debt
